business.headline: Turning 50? Here's how to protect your retirement savings, explains financial advisorHitting 50 can be a mix of pride and worry, especially when it comes to money. Even after years of saving and investing, many fear their retirement funds may not last as long as planned. Here are expert tips to safeguard your savings.

Errors in ITR filing? 3 simple ways to fix it: Revise, rectify or updateWorried about spotting a mistake in your ITR after filing? You're not alone. Errors happen to many taxpayers. Thankfully, the system gives you not one but three ways to fix them. Let's have a look.

Should you still bet on IT stocks as H-1B visa worries resurface?The US move on H-1B visa has stirred fears of rising costs and tighter restrictions on tech firms that rely on sending skilled workers to client locations.

GST 2.0 rate cut: Groceries, electronic items get cheaper this festive seasonThis report examines the impact of GST rate changes on household budgets, focusing on groceries and electronics. Items like chocolates and shampoos are now cheaper, with shampoos moving from an 18% to a 5% tax bracket. In contrast, aerated drinks are subject to a 'sin tax'. The report highlights significant savings, noting, "an average saving of 10% will mean 5000 rupees per month saving" for a consumer with a monthly income of one lakh rupees. The changes are presented as a "festive gift from the Modi government," with major electronics also seeing price drops. Televisions over 32 inches, previously in a 28% slab, are now taxed at 18%, resulting in substantial savings for consumers looking to upgrade. Washing machines, refrigerators, and dishwashers also benefit from a 10% tax reduction.

Live: GST 2.0 kicks off, BJP urges traders to pass on relief to consumersThe GST Council has approved major tax reforms effective today, September 22, introducing a simplified two-rate structure of 5% and 18% to ease compliance and lower costs. Essential items like soaps, shampoos, bicycles, and packaged foods will now attract 5% GST, while appliances such as ACs and large TVs will be taxed at 18%, down from 28%. Luxury and sin goods, including tobacco and high-end cars, will continue to face a 40% levy plus compensation cess. Follow Indiatoday.in for latest updates.

Tech Mahindra, TCS, Infosys: Why are IT stocks falling today?Tech Mahindra was the worst hit, sliding nearly 5% in early trade. Infosys, Tata Consultancy Services (TCS), HCLTech and Wipro also fell more than 2.5% each. The Nifty IT index shed almost 3%, making it one of the day's worst-performing sectoral indices.
Sensex down 346 points, Nifty below 25,300; Tech Mahindra tanks 6%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 267.56 points to 82,358.67, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 48.60 points to 25,278.45​​​​​​​ as of 9:25 am.

Kunal Bahl, rejected for H-1B, consoles techies: I did well in India, didn't I?While India has long been the biggest beneficiary of H-1B visas, accounting for 71% of all approvals last year, uncertainty has cast a shadow over careers, education plans and the information technology industry.

GST 2.0 kicks in: What changes in your shopping bill from today  Live UpdatesThe government expects GST 2.0 to reduce compliance challenges, cut disputes, and make goods and services cheaper for households. Read on to know which items get cheaper and which turn costlier from today.

GST 2.0 comes into effect: What's cheaper and costlier from todayAs the new rates under GST 2.0 come into effect from Monday, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said the reforms will boost savings for households, farmers, shopkeepers, and businesses.

ITR refund under processing? Here's how to check status and what to do nextIf your refund remains under processing, first ensure your ITR has been e-verified, as refunds cannot be processed without this step. You can also check Form 26AS to verify if the refund has already been credited to your account.

From grocery runs to gym sessions: What today's homebuyers really wantToday's urban buyers want more than a home, they seek a lifestyle where comfort, convenience, and community come together, and daily needs, work, and wellness coexist effortlessly.

Piyush Goyal to visit US for trade talks on September 22 amid tariff, H-1B tensionsThe minister will visit New York and will be accompanied by special secretary in the ministry Rajesh Agrawal and other officials.

H-1B visa holders cancel trips to India for weddings, Diwali amid new fee hikeWhile many cancelled plans to travel at the last minute while waiting to board flights to India, several others already in India are scrambling to return amid lack of clarity after Trump on Friday signed a proclamation to raise the H-1B visa fees.

Amul cuts prices of 700 products, ghee cheaper by Rs 40 per litre from Sept 22Amul, marketed by the Gujarat Cooperative Milk Marketing Federation (GCMMF), on Saturday announced a price reduction for over 700 products, including ghee, butter, ice cream, cheese, and frozen snacks. The move comes after a GST rate cut, with the company passing the benefits to consumers.

H-1B visa fee hike will disrupt Indian tech ops, 1-day deadline concerning: NasscomNasscom cautioned that Indian nationals employed on H-1B visas will be directly impacted, while technology companies will face disruption in ongoing client projects requiring onshore deployment.

ITR refund delayed? Here's why the process may take longer this yearTax refunds this year are taking longer than usual, leaving many taxpayers waiting and prompting questions about delays, processing times, and what to expect in the weeks ahead.

Why India's insurance market has become a breeding ground for mis-sellingFrom loans tied to unwanted policies to agents chasing fat commissions, insurance policies that were meant to shield families have instead become a trap for many.

Cryptocurrency a bigger challenge to dollar than BRICS currency, says WEF PresidentSpeaking in an exclusive conversation with India Today TV, Brende said de-dollarisation is unlikely in the near term. He added that cryptocurrency is a bigger challenge to the dollar than a potential BRICS currency.

India powers 18% of global growth, WEF chief sees tariff row with US easing soonIn an exclusive interaction with India Today TV, WEF President Borge Brende described India's rapid expansion as a source of "exported prosperity" to the world. "Just imagine what it means for global prosperity. So, you are exporting prosperity by growing so fast," he said.

A widow's wait, a worker's fight: The human struggle behind PF claimsIn Part 2 of our series on the PF claim crisis, we look at why, for so many Indians, withdrawing their own savings has turned into a struggle, forcing them to fight for money that is rightfully theirs.

Will October bring a market breakout? Earnings, GST price cuts fuel hopeAdani stocks led the rally on Thursday following Sebi's dismissal of Hindenburg Research allegations. Experts say this could mark the start of renewed market optimism.
Sensex, Nifty end lower amid profit booking; Adani Group shares gainThe S&P BSE Sensex slipped 387.73 points to close at 82,626.23, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 96.55 points to settle at 25,327.05.

Explained: Why Intel shares jumped 22% after Nvidia's $5 billion investmentThe Nvidia-Intel deal not only fuels Intel's stock surge but strengthens its next-gen manufacturing and product integration, creating potential market shifts that could challenge competitors like AMD over the coming years.

Waiting for your ITR refund? Here is how to track itAfter filing your ITR, the next big question is, when will the refund come? Instead of guessing, you can quickly check the progress on the official portal.
Sensex tumbles 500 points: Is the stock market rally over?Around midday, the S&P BSE Sensex was down 471.67 points, settling at 82,542.29, while the NSE Nifty50 declined 130.20 points to 25,293.40.

Does the Income Tax Department delay refunds above Rs 50,000?With the ITR deadline now behind us, many taxpayers are anxiously waiting for their refunds. A common doubt is whether larger refunds, such as those above Rs 50,000, take longer to arrive.

New GST rates from September 22: Why you should double-check product MRPsConsumers must remain alert as new GST rates take effect September 22; checking MRPs carefully ensures savings are realised, avoiding overpayment due to old pricing or retailer confusion.

Adani Power in focus as Sebi clean chit sparks fresh rally in Adani Group stocksAdani Power's move stood out, as analysts see strong momentum beyond the short-term sentiment boost. Global brokerage Morgan Stanley has initiated coverage with an 'Overweight' rating and a target price of Rs 818 per share.

Adani stocks jump up to 10 % after Sebi clean chit in Hindenburg caseThe gains were broad-based across the group's listed entities. Adani Total Gas led the rally, soaring 10% on the BSE. Adani Power climbed 7%, while flagship Adani Enterprises advanced nearly 5%.
Sensex down over 150 points, Nifty below 25,400; Adani Group stocks jumpThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 260.39 points to 82,753.5, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 56.95 points to 25,366.65 as of 9:29 am.

PF transfers to become easier: Here's what's changing for employeesThe Employees' Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO) has now introduced two reforms aimed at tackling these bottlenecks. First, it has launched a Passbook Lite feature within the Member Sewa portal.

EPFO launches Passbook Lite: Check features, how it helps membersUntil now, employees had to log in to a separate Passbook Portal to see details of contributions and withdrawals. With the launch of Passbook Lite, members can now access this information directly on the EPFO Member Portal, using just one login.

Adani Group gets clean chit from Sebi over Hindenburg claimsHindenburg Research had alleged that four Adani group companies lent Rs 6.2 billion ($87.4 million) in 2020, without properly disclosing it in financial statements.
Can you own a credit card without a bank account? Find outYou don't always need a savings account to apply for a credit card; new digital options are changing the rules. Have a look.

Are Fed rate cut and tariff relief setting up a market rally?A softer stance from the US Federal Reserve and the possibility of reduced reciprocal tariffs have lifted investor mood. The big question now: are these triggers enough to set off a sustained rally in Indian markets?

Sensex, Nifty extend rally on US-India trade talk optimismThe S&P BSE Sensex rose 318.97 points to finish at 83,012.68, while the NSE Nifty50 advanced 93.35 points to settle at 25,423.60. Broader markets, however, displayed mixed momentum, with several indices ending weaker as profit-booking set in.

US may scrap 25% penal duty on India, cut reciprocal tariffs to 10–15%: CEAChief Economic Adviser V. Anantha Nageswaran indicated that the US reciprocal tariff on Indian goods, currently at 25%, may be reduced to 10–15%.

Missed your ITR deadline? 3 filing options you can still useIf you missed the Income Tax Return (ITR) deadline, don't panic. Taxpayers still have ways to stay compliant and avoid penalties, with three key filing options available even after the due date.

Want to get a loan this festive season? Here's what you can doFrom new clothes and jewellery to family trips and home makeovers, festivals often come with added costs. A personal loan can help bridge the gap, here's a simple guide to getting one this festive season.

entertainment.headline: My safe place: Jackky Bhagnani's love note for Rakul Preet on Wife Appreciation DayJackky Bhagnani celebrated Wife Appreciation Day by sharing a heartfelt video and note for Rakul Preet Singh, calling her his best friend and safe place.

If Hollywood has Tom Cruise, we have Akshay Kumar, says Mahesh BhattBollywood's Akshay Kumar is hailed as an action hero on par with Hollywood's Tom Cruise, following a daring stunt in the film 'Angaaray' that left director Mahesh Bhatt in awe. He earned high praise on 'The Kapil Sharma Show' finale.

Anu Malik says Zubeen Garg suffered blackouts, shares his devotion to social issuesSinger Zubeen Garg's death led to widespread mourning across Assam and the music industry. Composer Anu Malik remembered working with Garg and recalled his health struggles during his Bollywood years.

Nagaland minister slams student's comment on Zubeen Garg: He was Northeast's prideA Nagaland minister recently criticised Naga students' remarks about singer Zubeen Garg at Kaziranga University.  He called him the pride of Northeast.

Tom Holland suffers concussion on Spider-Man Brand New Day set, filming haltedBritish actor Tom Holland sustained a mild concussion on 'Spider-Man: Brand New Day' set. The film's production has been paused for several days as a precaution.

Jolly LLB 3 box office Day 3: Akshay's film gets franchise's biggest 1st weekend'Jolly LLB 3' recorded a solid opening weekend in India. The Akshay Kumar and Arshad Warsi-starrer legal comedy is doing better than its predecessors in the franchise. This is a promising sign, but Monday will tell us more about its long-time potential at the box office.

Kajol reveals the acting trick that helped her nail a DDLJ sceneKajol shares her unique acting method that helps her perform challenging scenes with conviction. She explains how momentarily believing in a character keeps her performances authentic yet true to herself.

Actor Radhika Sarathkumar's mother Geetha dies, funeral in Chennai todayActor Radhika Sarathkumar's mother, Geetha Radha, died at the age of 86 on Sunday night. Her funeral will be held at 4.30 pm at Besant Nagar Crematorium in Chennai.

Mohanlal to play cameo in Akshay Kumar-Saif's Haiwaan, confirms PriyadarshanMohanlal will appear in a cameo in the upcoming thriller 'Haiwaan'. Director Priyadarshan confirmed his casting in a recent interview.

Pawan Kalyan wields sword at OG event, narrowly misses his bodyguard. WatchPawan Kalyan made a dramatic entry wielding a katana (sword) at the 'They Call Him OG' pre-release event in Hyderabad. The sword narrowly missed his bodyguard.

general news.headline: 30 killed as Pakistan Air Force bombs village in Khyber PakhtunkhwaAround 2 am today, the Pakistan Air Force dropped eight LS-6 bombs from JF-17 fighter jets on the Matre Dara village in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province.

Unfortunate: Supreme Court on speculation of pilot error in Air India 171 crashThe Supreme Court, while responding to a Public Interest Litigation (PIL) seeking an independent, court-monitored probe into the Air India plane crash, observed that it was "irresponsible" to blame pilots based on a preliminary inquiry report.

HPV positive isn't always a cervical cancer diagnosisWhile HPV is linked to cervical cancer, not every infection is dangerous, and with regular screening and vaccination, most cases of the disease can be prevented.

Why Modi's big bet is now on India's middle class, not big corporatesAfter the income tax relief, the GST rate rationalisation will leave more money in the hands of India's middle class, which will, in turn, boost India's consumption-driven economy. The Modi government is placing a big bet on small consumers after large corporates pocketed tax-break gains.

Pakistan batter Sahibzada Farhan's gun-shot celebration causes uproarAsia Cup 2025 IND vs PAK: Sahibzada Farhan's 58-run innings should have been the highlight, but his provocative gun gesture overshadowed his batting heroics. Coupled with Haris Rauf's fighter-jet salute, Sunday's clash once again blurred the line between cricket and politics, turning a high-stakes match into a flashpoint for controversy.

In Trump's H-1B harakiri, China seizes its moment. Once againTrump's sudden USD 100,000 H-1B visa fee is pushing global STEM talent towards China. This shift threatens America's technological leadership and offers China a strategic advantage in the global tech race.

Trump admin linking paracetamol use in pregnancy to autism in kidsThe Trump administration is preparing to announce a link between the use of paracetamol during pregnancy and an increased risk of autism, according to reports. However, medical guidelines so far have shown that paracetamol is safe for use in pregnancy.

Autumn equinox 2025: Why the day and night will be equal todayFor those in the Northern Hemisphere, sunlight will now gradually diminish each day until the winter solstice on December 21, the longest night of the year.

sports.headline: Yamal, Raphinha and Dembele race for Ballon d'Or: How to watch Paris ceremony liveThe 2025 Ballon d'Or showdown in Paris features Dembele, Yamal, and Raphinha as frontrunners, while Mohamed Salah remains a notable contender. PSG and Real Madrid players may miss the ceremony, adding intrigue to the awards night.

His composed innings earned praise from former Pakistan captain Misbah-ul-Haq, highlighting a shift in the high-pressure rivalry.

Dembele remains favourite for the award, while Luis Enrique, Desire Doue, and other PSG nominees may also be absent.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
